other_tests.findings: A novel translocation was detected affecting the lncRNA, RMST, on chromosome 12 in the absence of any other KS mutations.
WES revealed a rare missense variant in the gene of leptin receptor, LEPR: p.V658I predicted to be benign.
No CNVs were detected in IGD cohort of 1,386 probands and no CNVs were detected in a large cohort of controls.
Patient-specific iPSCs were confirmed to be pluripotent by expression of pluripotency markers.
other_tests.changes_over_time: RMST transcripts in KS1-iPSC during differentiation showed significant reductions in all isoforms of RMST (less than 10% of healthy cells).

other_tests.findings: Efficiency of NCC induction was monitored based on SOX10 immunostaining.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During NCC development, RMST transcripts increased for control iPSCs while in KS1-iPSCs they remained significantly reduced.
